## DurableContext.invoke() method

Invokes another durable function with the specified input

**Signature:**

```typescript
invoke<TInput, TOutput>(funcId: string, input?: TInput, config?: InvokeConfig<TInput, TOutput>): DurablePromise<TOutput>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter

</th><th>

Type

</th><th>

Description

</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

funcId

</td><td>

string

</td><td>

Function ID or ARN of the durable function to invoke

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

input

</td><td>

TInput

</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Input data to pass to the invoked function

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

config

</td><td>

[InvokeConfig](./durable-execution-sdk-js.invokeconfig.md)<!-- -->&lt;TInput, TOutput&gt;

</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Optional configuration for serialization

</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[DurablePromise](./durable-execution-sdk-js.durablepromise.md)<!-- -->&lt;TOutput&gt;

## Exceptions

{<!-- -->InvokeError<!-- -->} When the invoked function fails or times out

## Example

```typescript
const result = await context.invoke("payment-processor-function", {
  amount: 100,
  currency: "USD",
});
```
